keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and SEWELL CHAN
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and Sewell Chan from London. Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Remarks by Donald Tusk, president of the European Council, signaled Europe’s determined turn away from Germany’s approach to absorbing migrants.

headline.print_headline: Citing Strain on Continent, E.U. Leader Warns Away Economic Migrants
headline.main: Europe, Reeling From Strain, Tells Economic Migrants: Don’t Bother

snippet: Remarks by Donald Tusk, president of the European Council, signaled Europe’s determined turn away from Germany’s approach to absorbing migrants.
abstract: European Council Pres Donald Tusk urges migrants not to attempt emigration to Europe; starkest appeal yet, ostensibly directed to economic migrants and not refugees from war in Syria and Iraq, reflects desperation of continent's leaders; pledges support for Greece, where crisis is currently most dire, and asks Turkey for more help with deterrence.
